titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Sam Manners papers, 1966-1988 LSC.2259
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Elsie Doolan with supervision from Julie Graham, May 2015; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cub√©.

p.date: Online finding aid last uploaded 22 November 2016.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

publicationstmt.p: Finding aid description and metadata in this record are licensed under a Creative Commons Public Domain Designation (CC0 1.0 Universal). See LSC's Metadata Rights Statement for more information.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-08-08 13:32:04 -0700.

did.unittitle: Sam Manners papers
did.abstract: Sam Manners was a television and motion picture producer with credits such as Dummy, Guyana Tragedy: The Story of Jim Jones, The Naked City, and Route 66. The bulk of the collection consists of bound scripts from Manners' television and motion picture projects. Also included are a small amount of photographs and biographical materials.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Portions of this collection, boxes 7 and 12, are restricted from access and requires advanced notice for use.

userestrict.head: Conditions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Sam Manners Papers (Collection 2259). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Elsie Doolan with assistance from Julie Graham, 2015.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Problematic Content and Description in UCLA's Library Collections and Archives.

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: Savino Maneri, later changed to Sam Manners, was born March 29, 1921 in Cleveland, Ohio. Manners began his career as a production supervisor on the television series, The Adventures of Rin-Tin-Tin. He went on to become an associate producer, a production executive and second unit director on the series Naked City, and associate producer, executive in charge of production and second unit director on the series Route 66. Among his other television credits are the series Dundee and Cullhane, Petrocelli, and The Wild Wild West, and the television movies Dummy and Guyana Tragedy: The Story of Jim Jones, which were both Emmy nominated for outstanding special. Manners' motion picture credits include Cleopatra Jones, The Deadly Trackers, and Valdez is Coming, among others. Sam Manners died June 1, 2012.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of materials related to the career of television and motion picture producer Sam Manners. Included are bound television and motion picture scripts, photographs, and a scrapbook created by Manners. The majority of the scripts document Manners' television career including Adventures of Rin-Tin-Tin, Dummy, Dundee and the Cullhane, The Naked City, Route 66, Petrocelli, and The Wild Wild West among others. Motion picture projects represented include Cleopatra Jones, The Deadly Trackers, and Valdez is Coming, among others. A small number of scripts are authored by Manners. The small collection of photographs are professional and/or personal in nature. The scrapbook contains mostly clippings from magazines and newspapers and a small number of programs and photographs documenting Manners' career.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
1. Biographical Information
2. Television Projects
3. Motion Picture Projects
4. Photographs.

controlaccess.occupation: Television producers and directors -- United States -- Archives.
Motion picture producers and directors -- United States -- Archives.

did.unittitle: Biographical Information

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series consists of a scrapbook titled, Savino Maneri: This is Your Life? By Sam Manners.

did.unittitle: Savino Maneri: This is Your Life? by Sam Manners - scrapbook

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Mostly clippings from magazines and newspapers and a small number of programs and photographs documenting Manners' career.

did.unittitle: Television Projects

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series consists of bound scripts documenting a variety of television series and TV movies in which Manners was involved. Additionally there are a small number of photographs. The television series scripts represent programs such as Dundee and Cullhane, The Naked City, Rin-Tin-Tin , Route 66 , and The Wild Wild West, among others. Television movie scripts include Dummy, Hot Rod, and Pearl, among others. A small number of scripts were authored by Manners. The photographs are related to productions of Dummy, Pearl, and Route 66, among others. Notably absent are materials pertaining to Manner's Emmy nominated television movie Guyana Tragedy: The Story of Jim Jones. The series is arranged alphabetically by project title.
Boxes 7 and 12 are restricted from access and requires advanced notice for use.

did.unittitle: Motion Picture Projects

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series consists of bound scripts from a variety of motion picture projects in which Manners was involved. Included are scripts documenting Cleopatra Jones, The Deadly Trackers, and Valdez is Coming, among others. Additionally, there is a small number of photographs from the film The Deadly Trackers. The series is arranged alphabetically by project title.

did.unittitle: Billy the Kid Versus Dracula! - script
Black Gunn - script
Cleopatra Jones - revised draft script
The Deadly Trackers- final draft script
[The Deadly Trackers] photographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Sam Manners, Richard Harris, and other unidentified persons.

did.unittitle: Heaven with a Gun - script
Jesse James Meets Frankenstein's Daughter - script
The Last Hard Man - final script
Valdez is Coming - revised final script
Will Grow the Seeds by - script written by Sam Manners
Photographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The series consists of personal photographs and photographs not identified with known television or film projects. Includes images of Joan Crawford, James Earl Jones, Rod Taylor, Sam Manners and other unidentified individuals. Additionally included are autographed photographs of Bernie Casey, Dean Martin, Joe Namath, and Paul Richards. There is no specific arrangement to the series. Additional photographs may be found in the Television Projects series and the Motion Picture Projects series.

did.unittitle: Personal photographs (5 items)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Mostly young Sam Manners.

did.unittitle: Manners and others (mostly unidentified) (20 items)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: With Sam Manners, Joan Crawford, James Earl Jones, Rod Taylor, and other unidentified persons.

did.unittitle: Signed photographs (5 items)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Photographs signed to either Joyce or Sam [Manners]. Head shots of Bernie Casey, Dean Martin, Joe Namath, and Paul Richards. One photograph with a signature that is undecipherable.
